definition: to keep quiet out of fear (idiom)

sentences.english: In face of autocratic and political pressure, we will not be silent.
sentences.chinese: 面对强权和专制的各方压力，我们不会噤若寒蝉。

sentences.english: Although nurses carefully after the family member, still kept silent.
sentences.chinese: 虽经家人细心看护，仍噤若寒蝉。

sentences.english: The woman driver naturally shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 女司机情急呼救，全车乘客噤若寒蝉。

definition: lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
angry, but not daring to speak out (idiom); obliged to remain silent about one's resentment/unable to voice objections
pinyin: gan3 nu4 er2 bu4 gan3 yan2

definition: lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to utter a word/to make a sound/to cheep/to squeak/also pr. [zi1 sheng1]
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
